definition: to receive/to accept/to suffer/subjected to/to bear/to stand/pleasant/(passive marker)
to go through hell for the sake of keeping up appearances (idiom)
pinyin: si3 yao4 mian4 zi5 huo2 shou4 zui4

sentences.english: He cumbered himself with an overcoat on a warm day.
sentences.chinese: 大熱天穿着件大衣簡直使他活受罪。

sentences.english: He's so impatient that waiting in queues is sheer purgatory for him.
sentences.chinese: 他毫無耐性，對他來說排隊等候完全是活受罪。

sentences.english: The two first dances, however, brought a return of distress; they were dances of mortification.
sentences.chinese: 頭兩場舞重新使他覺得煩惱，那是兩場活受罪的跳舞。

definition: to endure/to suffer/hardships/torments/a hard time/a nuisance
to regard face as all-important/to consider loss of face unthinkable
to go through hell for the sake of keeping up appearances (idiom)
pinyin: si3 yao4 mian4 zi5 huo2 shou4 zui4

definition: see 愛面子|爱面子[ai4 mian4 zi5]
disaster one brings on oneself/to be reponsible for something bad that happens to oneself/to have only oneself to blame
to end one's suffering by dying quickly and being reincarnated/(fig.) to get it over with
to suffer as a consequence of one's own actions/you asked for it/to bring it on oneself (sth unpleasant)
lit. to swell one's face up by slapping it to look imposing (idiom); to seek to impress by feigning more than one's abilities
pinyin: da3 zhong3 lian3 chong1 pang4 zi5
